Tizen: Linux Foundation, Tizen Association, Samsung, Intel
Sailfish OS: Sailfish Alliance, Mer, Jolla and Sailfish community contributors
Ubuntu Touch: UBports and Ubuntu community contributors (previously Canonical Ltd.)

Android: Free and open-source, but usually bundled with proprietary apps and drivers[8][9]
iOS: Proprietary except for open source components
Tizen: Free and open-source, but the SDK is proprietary and closed source
Sailfish OS: Free and open-source, but the UI is proprietary and closed source
Ubuntu Touch: Free and open-source, mainly the GPL

Android: ARM (32-bit ARMv7-A and 64-bit ARMv8-A only), x86, x86-64[10]

Windows 10 Mobile: 7+: XNA (.NET C#), Silverlight, native C/C++ (only for vendors and partners[11]) 8+: .NET C#, VB.NET, Silverlight, native C/C++, WinRTP (XMLA), DirectX
BlackBerry 10: C/ C++: Native SDK, C++/Qt: Cascades SDK, HTML5/Javascript/CSS: Webworks SDK, ActionScript: Adobe AIR, Java: Android runtime
Ubuntu Touch: Apps: HTML5, QML, Go, JavaScript, C++ System: C, C++, QML

Android: No[20] since Android 4.1[21] and Android 4.3[22] and more restrictions on Android 4.4[23]
Partial system updates since Oreo[25] 3rd party software like LineageOS[26]
